definition: to smoke/to fumigate/to assail the nostrils/to perfume
fragrance/warm/to educate/variant of 熏[xun1]/to smoke/to fumigate
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]

sentences.english: Juicy, rich and youthful, offering smoky blueberry and spice scents.
sentences.chinese: 馥郁醇香，充满活力，散发出蓝莓的熏香及辛香气息。

sentences.english: Families lit incense and wept in front of piles of rubble.
sentences.chinese: 幸存的人家燃起熏香，在一片废墟中悲泣。

sentences.english: Then, methought, the air grew denser, perfumed from an unseen censer.
sentences.chinese: 接着我觉得空气变得稠密，被无形香炉熏香。

sentences.english: He bathed, perfumed himself, dressed, and covered himself with ornaments and flower garlands.
sentences.chinese: 大仁慈王沐浴更衣，熏香了自身并戴上饰品和花环。

sentences.english: It is used as incense, in perfumery , and in traditional medicine.
sentences.chinese: 它被用作熏香，在香料，和在传统医学中。

sentences.english: First of all, the incense that wasw being burned was impure.
sentences.chinese: 首先，正在燃烧的熏香是脏的。

sentences.english: Kill Lycanthoth Vandals and loot 6 Polluted Incense from their corpses.
sentences.chinese: 杀莱坎索斯蛮人拾取6个受污染的熏香。

sentences.english: Burn some incense or sage and light a candle if you so wish.
sentences.chinese: 如果希望就点燃一些熏香或蜡烛。

sentences.english: Other people burned myrrh as an incense during cremations.
sentences.chinese: 其他人在火葬的时候燃烧没药作为熏香之用。

sentences.english: Some play meditative music and burn candles or incense.
sentences.chinese: 一些人放冥想音乐和燃烧蜡烛或熏香。

sentences.english: The musty aroma of incense made her head swim.
sentences.chinese: 熏香发霉的气味令她感到头晕。

sentences.english: It actually tasted and smelled like incense.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，它尝起来闻起来都像是熏香。

definition: Styrax officinalis or Styrax benzoin/benzoin resin (used in TCM)/Benzoinum
snowdrop bush (Styrax officinalis)/gum storax, used in TCM
